extensionDescription.message: Save, edit and browse your Pinboard links and notes.

optionsLoginManual.message: You can find your API token on a settings page under the password tab. It is a short opaque identifier that allows Pinboard-X to make API calls without ever asking for your password.

optionsLoginFormPlaceholder.description: Options page - login form input placeholder

optionsLoginFormSubmit.description: Options page - login form submit button text

optionsWelcomeMessage.message: Hi. You are logged in as $name$.

optionsSignOut.description: Options page - sign out button text

optionsDefaultViewAllText.description: Options page - default view option all

optionsDefaultViewAddText.description: Options page - default view option add url

optionsToReadChecboxByDefault.message: "To read" checkbox by default (add url view)

optionsUseDescriptionMetaTag.message: Use description meta tag as a URL description (add url view)

popupOpenYourPinboardProfile.description: Popup - link to users profile in a header

popupErrorMessage.message: Error occured. Please make sure that your token is valid.

popupErrorButtonMessage.description: Popup - error button message shown accross the pop-up

popupLoggedOutViewMessage.message: You can find your API token on a settings page under the password tab. It is a short opaque identifier that allows Pinboard-X to make API calls without ever asking for your password.

popupLoggedOutViewButtonMessage.message: Go to option page to log in
popupLoggedOutViewButtonMessage.description: Popup - legged out user button message

popupInvalidProtocolParagraph.message: Allowed protocoles are http, https, javascript, mailto, ftp and file. Unfortunatelly you cannot save this URL.

popupInvalidProtocolButton.message: Find out more in Pinboard API documentation
